doc:
Lucille Bliss https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucille_Bliss 0 Lucille Theresa Bliss (March 31, 1916 – November 8, 2012) was an American actress, known in the Bay Area and in Hollywood as the Girl With a Thousand Voices.A New York City native, Bliss lent her voice to numerous television characters, including the title character of the very first made-for-television cartoon, Crusader Rabbit, Smurfette on the popular 1980s cartoon The Smurfs and Ms. Bitters on the Nickelodeon animated series Invader ZIM. In addition to her television roles, she was known for her work as a voice actress in feature films. Lucille_Theresa_Bliss ( March_31_,_1916 – November_8_,_2012 ) was an_American_actress , known in the_Bay_Area and in Hollywood as the_Girl With a_Thousand_Voices.A_New_York_City_native , Bliss lent her_voice to numerous_television_characters , including the_title_character of the_very_first_made-for-television_cartoon , Crusader_Rabbit , Smurfette on the_popular_1980s_cartoon The_Smurfs_and_Ms._Bitters on the_Nickelodeon_animated_series_Invader_ZIM . In addition to her_television_roles , she was_known for her_work as a_voice_actress in feature_films .
